section.para:
Equinox P2
Nexus repository
P2 repository
P2 repository Nexus Professional supports the P2 Repository format. The P2 repository format is a provisioning platform for Eclipse components. For more information about the P2 repository format, see the Equinox P2 documentation on the Eclipse Wiki.

section.title: Managing P2 Repositories
section.para:
P2 repository
management of The following sections detail the procedures for creating and managing P2 repositories.

section.title: Proxy P2 Repositories
section.para:
P2 repository
proxy repository Nexus can proxy a P2 Repository. To create a new proxy P2 repository:

listitem.para: Click Repositories in the Left Navigation Menu.
Click the Add.. button above the list of Nexus repositories, and choose Proxy repository from the dropdown of repository types.
In the New Proxy Repository window,
Select Eclipse P2 Repository as the Provider.
Supply an id and a repository name.
Enter the URL to the remote P2 repository as the Remote Storage location.

section.para: provides some sample configuration used to create a proxy of the Apache Felix P2 repository.

section.title: Grouping P2 Repositories
section.para:
P2 repository
repository group Just like Nexus can group Maven repositories and OBR repositories, Nexus can also be configured to group P2 Repositories. To group P2 repositories:

listitem.para: Click Repositories in the Left Navigation Menu.
Click the Add.. button above the list of Nexus repositories, and choose Repository Group from the dropdown of repository types.
In the New Repository Group window,
Select Eclipse P2 Artifacts as the Group Provider.
Drag and drop one or more P2 repositories into the new group.
Supply an id and a repository name.

section.para: shows an example of the a new repository group which contains two P2 proxy repositories.
